Sure, here is an outline for "What to Include in Your Pre-Construction Checklist" silo topic:

H1: What to Include in Your Pre-Construction Checklist: A Comprehensive Guide for Homeowners
============================================================================================

H2: Introduction (100-200 words)
--------------------------------

* Brief overview of the importance of a pre-construction checklist for homeowners
* Explanation of how a comprehensive pre-construction checklist can help avoid budget blowouts, project delays, and legal disputes

H2: Site Selection (150-250 words)
----------------------------------

* Importance of choosing the right building site, including factors such as location, zoning, and site-specific costs
* Tips for conducting a site analysis and selecting the best building site for your needs
* Discussion of common site selection mistakes and how to avoid them

H2: Budget (150-250 words)
--------------------------

* Explanation of how to estimate construction costs, including land costs, construction costs, professional fees, and contingency funds
* Tips for managing construction costs and avoiding budget blowouts
* Discussion of common budgeting mistakes and how to avoid them

H2: Building Regulations and Permits (150-250 words)
----------------------------------------------------

* Explanation of NSW building codes, zoning laws, and other regulations that may affect your construction project
* Discussion of the importance of obtaining the necessary building permits and approvals before commencing construction
* Tips for ensuring compliance with building regulations and avoiding permitting issues

H2: Project Scope (150-250 words)
---------------------------------

* Importance of defining your project scope and creating a list of must-haves and nice-to-haves
* Tips for prioritizing your needs and making informed decisions during the design phase
* Discussion of common project scope mistakes and how to avoid them

H2: Home Design (150-250 words)
-------------------------------

* Explanation of how to choose a home design that suits your needs and budget
* Discussion of customizing an existing plan to save on architectural costs
* Tips for ensuring your home design meets your needs and fits your budget

H2: Contractor Selection (150-250 words)
----------------------------------------

* Importance of selecting a reputable builder for your construction project
* Discussion of how to research local builders, read reviews, and ask for recommendations
* Tips for interviewing potential builders and reviewing and finalizing contracts

H2: Timeline Management (150-250 words)
---------------------------------------

* Importance of setting a realistic timeline and developing a project schedule with milestones to track progress
* Tips for ensuring your construction team stays accountable and your project stays on track
* Discussion of common timeline management mistakes and how to avoid them

H2: Contingencies (150-250 words)
---------------------------------

* Explanation of how to identify potential risks and have a plan in place to manage them
* Discussion of how to allocate a contingency fund for unexpected expenses
* Tips for managing risks and avoiding unexpected expenses

H2: Conclusion (100-200 words)
------------------------------

* Recap of the importance of a comprehensive pre-construction checklist for homeowners
* Emphasis on the benefits of effectively managing your pre-construction checklist
* Call to action for homeowners to take the necessary steps to create a comprehensive pre-construction checklist for their construction project

Total word count: 1,300 - 2,100 words (depending on the length of each section)

The H1 tag is used for the main heading of the article, while H2 tags are used for the main sections of the article. H3 tags can be used for subheadings within each section, if necessary.
